aws::graph::propositions: # Factual Information from NTSB Report 86502
The defining event was loss of control on ground during landing-landing roll.
A runway excursion occurred during landing-landing roll.
The pilot held an airline transport certificate.
The pilot held a commercial certificate.
The pilot held a flight instructor certificate.
The pilot was 54 years old.
The pilot was male.
The pilot had airplane ratings for single-engine land.
The pilot had airplane ratings for multi-engine land.
The pilot occupied the rear seat.
The pilot had a glider aircraft rating.
The pilot had an instrument rating for airplane.
No second pilot was present.
The pilot had instructor ratings for airplane multi-engine.
The pilot had instructor ratings for airplane single-engine.
The pilot had instructor ratings for instrument airplane.
No toxicology was performed on the pilot.
The pilot held a Class 1 medical certification with waivers/limitations.
The pilot's last Federal Aviation Administration medical exam was on April 23, 2012.
The pilot was an occupational pilot.
The pilot's last flight review or equivalent was on September 26, 2012.
The pilot had 11688 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The pilot had 9 total flight hours in this make and model of aircraft.
The pilot had 5599 hours as Pilot In Command in all aircraft.
The pilot had 33 flight hours in the last 90 days in all aircraft.
The pilot had 21 flight hours in the last 30 days in all aircraft.
The pilot had 2 flight hours in the last 24 hours in all aircraft.

text:
# Factual Information

## History of Flight

| Landing-landing roll | Loss of control on ground (Defining event) |
| Landing-landing roll | Runway excursion |

## Pilot Information

| Certificate: | Airline transport; Commercial; Flight instructor |
| Age: | 54,Male |
| Airplane Rating(s): | Single-engine land; Multi-engine land |
| Seat Occupied: | Rear |
| Other Aircraft Rating(s): | Glider |
| Restraint Used: |  |
| Instrument Rating(s): | Airplane |
| Second Pilot Present: | No |
| Instructor Rating(s): | Airplane multi-engine; Airplane single-engine; Instrument airplane |
| Toxicology Performed: | No |
| Medical Certification: | Class 1 With waivers/limitations |
| Last FAA Medical Exam: | April 23, 2012 |
| Occupational Pilot: | Yes |
| Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | September 26, 2012 |
| Flight Time: | 11688 hours (Total, all aircraft), 9 hours (Total, this make and model), 5599 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 33 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 21 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft), 2 hours (Last 24 hours, all aircraft) |
